title: [bug] [beta] WindowResized event broken on Mac

labels.name: status: needs triage
labels.description: This issue needs to triage, applied to new issues

body:
### Describe the bug

`tauri::WindowEvent::Resized` received through the main run event loop on MacOS never returns the correct size of the window, and instead returns the original size the window was created with.

This is a fairly new regression, not present in the latest alpha versions (I observed it only today when I was upgrading my library dependencies)



### Reproduction

`npm run create-tauri-app --beta`

Replace the `main` function with:

```
fn main() {
    let app = tauri::Builder::default()
        .plugin(tauri_plugin_shell::init())
        .invoke_handler(tauri::generate_handler![greet])
        .build(tauri::generate_context!())
        .expect("error while running tauri application");
    app.run(|app_handle, event| {
        match event {
            tauri::RunEvent::WindowEvent { event, .. } => {
                match event {
                    tauri::WindowEvent::Resized(new_size) => {
                        println!("Resized to: {:?}", new_size);
                    },
                    _ => {},
                }
            },
            _ => {},
        }
    });
}
```

### Expected behavior

While resizing the window I should see the console logs of new sizes of the window.

Instead I see this:
![Screenshot from 2024-03-20 12-50-29](https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/assets/6817875/180fc5e2-2005-4cdd-8fa0-b86d7364f9ac)
